Reviews.Title: Straight talk Extreme
Reviews.Author: Vee44
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone for the money. It performs better than any phone I have ever had. Plenty of memory, good sized processer, GMSA (AT&T;). The only phone a little better is the Optimus Showtime it has a front camera.

Reviews.Title: Super slow!
Reviews.Author: krysta
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for about a year now. I bought it right through the Straight Talk website, and let me tell you...mistake! At the time, it was the nicest phone that they had to purchase. Do not buy it. It is super slow, and lags all of the time. The camera has the absolute worst lag ever. Apps freeze up, then crash. The keyboard freezes up, and you have to restart the phone entirely for the keyboard to even type on it...and don't even get me started on the time it takes to restart this phone!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!!!!
Reviews.Author: Robert Cook
Reviews.Content: This by far is the worst phone I ever had.  The price for the thing is way to much for the horrendous performance.  Don't even think of playing music and trying to text at the same time....LAG, LAG, and more lag.  My old Motorola Bravo is faster than this piece of crap!  I installed android 4.2.2 on my Bravo and it has no issues at all if i would have known this I would not have bought the LG junk...

Reviews.Title: LG L40G Extreme Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: arleen
Reviews.Content: It did not work. When I called someone they could hear me but I could not hear them, even with the volume all the way up. I could only hear them on speaker phone, sent the phone back.

Reviews.Title: Really Great Phone
Reviews.Author: J Lech "sparkle1103"
Reviews.Content: I dont know what everyone is thinking negative about this phone. Ive had it since March and use it for the WiFi only and I think it looks great. It has many screen customizations. It could use more internal memory but thats what we paid for. It has Google Play Store where you can download any app. It works with ShopKick. One of the few phones that do. It has a customizable top bar where you can turn on WiFi and Bluetooth and many other features without having to go to settings. If you want to add apps or widgets to your 5 customizable screens you just hold down your finger on a blank part of the screen and the apps, widgets, wallpaper-anything comes up on the bottom and your 5 screens right above. You can make folders and pick your own color for say like a Games Folder or Banking Folder or any folder. It takes awhile to boot up but that is fine. All in all for wifi connection only this phone is a beaut.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Phone
Reviews.Author: cheetahcat1980
Reviews.Content: The price is a little higher on here than Walmart's website but they were sold out. This model runs on the AT&T; network and so far really enjoy it. It has larger fonts which is great and not too complicated to understand it's navigation's through menus. Nice having the larger screen and 4.0 Android as well.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Matt Wills
Reviews.Content: Painfully slow opening just the phone, and once it's open, sometimes takes more than a minute to actually complete a call.A long list of settings that do not survive a restart. Just a couple:You can rename Bluetooth devices, but it won't remember them.If you set a new default ringtone,﻿ you have to reset any custom ringtones all over again.Keyboard disappears in the middle of writing a text and can't get it back.I wish I didn't have to give it even one star.
